title: Augusta: Jacob C. Armentrout to Kate Armentrout, April 22, 1862
summary: Jacob tells Kate about troop movements around Winchester and throughout the Valley, changes in the leadership of the 5th Virginia Regiment, and recent desertions. He also includes news about family members. The beginning of the letter is unclear.
keywords: Desertion/Leave, Family, Military Authority, Troop Movement, American Civil War
